intro: Erucastrum laevigatum subsp. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth bladderwort, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, green, bladder-like structures that are used for trapping aquatic invertebrates. The plant typically grows in freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces small white or yellow flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in aquatic botany and ecological interactions.
